image.altText: David Speirs giving a press conference in front of a beach in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs says he will make a decision about his political future in the coming weeks as he launches his own plans for the algal bloom.

title.children: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs to make decision on political future by the end of year

image.altText: A woman and a man walk through glass doors, leaving a building

props.synopsis: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had resorted to eating food out of bins at her school, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm.

title.children: Alleged manslaughter victim resorted to eating from school bins, court told

image.altText: Oyster production at Coffin Bay on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

props.synopsis: A blockade at a boat ramp to prevent oysters from entering an open fishing bay, over fears of spreading the algal bloom, leads to the destruction of nearly $70,000 worth of oysters.

title.children: Blockade halts oyster relocation as nearly $70k worth destroyed

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: Three arrests have been made in two separate incidents in regional South Australia, one in which a man allegedly lit a fire before throwing a rock at firefighters and another involving a car being discovered in flames after allegedly leaving a "trail of destruction" on a property.

title.children: Charges laid after 'trail of destruction' and rock thrown at firefighters in regional SA

image.altText: A sign reading Yatala Labour Prison behind blurred greenery

props.synopsis: A prisoner was taken to the hospital after the second alleged violent assault in two weeks in the South Australian prison system.

title.children: Nine prisoners attacked inmate in latest SA prison assault, union says

image.altText: Three little penguins bunched together on sand

props.synopsis: The small, fragile colony of surviving little penguins on South Australia's Granite Island records a "significant increase" in numbers amid the state's harmful algal bloom.

title.children: 'Very fat' baby penguins raise hopes for SA colony despite algal bloom

image.altText: A worker at support service Orana.

props.synopsis: Some in the disability employment sector say they are operating in an increasingly complex and changing environment, and that there is a need for a clear way forward for organisations supporting people with complex needs.

title.children: Calls for road map for disability employment providers to meet growing push to transform

image.altText: Police including two armed with large guns, behind a table full of drugs, cash and firearms.

props.synopsis: An international covert sting linked to the encrypted AN0M platform which brought down hundreds of alleged criminals and netted cash, drugs and weapons has reached a new phase.

title.children: 'Unprecedented' Operation Ironside sting enters new era

image.altText: Warren Tredrea and Mark Williams lift premiership cup

props.synopsis: The Port Adelaide Football Club continues to describe Warren Tredrea as one of its greatest-ever players — but on Friday it dismissed him from its board of directors.

title.children: Warren Tredrea was the Power's premiership captain, but has now been booted from its board

image.altText: A smartphone with an Airbnb logo on it in front of the same logo being projected on a screen.

props.synopsis: A council in South Australia wants to charge short-stay rentals such as AirBnBs at a higher rate, saying they act as businesses.

title.children: SA council considers classing short-stay rentals as businesses

image.altText: An over the shoulder shot of two women looking at an old letter.

props.synopsis: Sixty years ago in Canada, 12-year-old Diane Hatt went searching for a pen pal in Australia. She found one in South Australian Joy Doevendans and they've become best friends.

title.children: Pen pals for 60 years, Joy and Diane live on opposite sides of the world

image.altText: The old Snowtown bank.

props.synopsis: The South Australian Parole Administrative Review Commissioner will start hearing submissions in December as to why Snowtown killer James Vlassakis should not be released on parole.

title.children: Commissioner to hear submissions on why Snowtown killer should not get parole

image.altText: A view of the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

props.synopsis: The Australasian College of Emergency Medicine says on a day in September there were 70 admitted inpatients in the Royal Adelaide Hospital's emergency department that has 68 beds — a claim disputed by SA Health.

title.children: Emergency doctors say RAH admitted more patients than bed limit, SA Health denies claim

image.altText: Stephen Rue

props.synopsis: A Senate grilling of Optus executives reveals the company sat on information about deaths resulting from its triple-0 outage for nearly a day before telling the public.

title.children: Optus held 11 crisis meetings before telling government about triple-0 deaths

image.altText: A closer shot of the damaged Leeuwin.

props.synopsis: A lack of effective communication contributed to a collision between the sail training ship Leeuwin II and a container ship in Fremantle Harbour last year that injured two crew members, a new report has found.

title.children: Distracted pilot on phone as huge ship crashed into Fremantle Harbour

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark suit, white blouse and dark glasses leaves court.

props.synopsis: A Perth mother who stabbed her daughter's teenage boyfriend when she found him semi-naked in the family home avoids a prison sentence.

title.children: Mother who stabbed daughter's secret boyfriend avoids jail

image.altText: A blonde-haired caucasian man wearing a black suit and red tie makes a grumpy expression

props.synopsis: Donald Trump says he felt badly for the British royal family after King Charles stripped his brother Andrew Mountbatten Windsor of his title as prince amid mounting pressure over his ties to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title.children: Trump says pressure over Epstein scandal was 'terrible thing' for UK royals

image.altText: A bathroom with black and white marble throughout with a toilet next to a window with a chandelier over it

props.synopsis: The US president says the new look is more appropriate than the "Art Deco green tile style" from the last renovation in the 1940s.

title.children: Trump renovates White House bathroom with marble and chandelier over toilet

image.altText: A man with an eyebrow piercing and moustache

props.synopsis: Thousands of pages of evidence had to be reissued to defence team after it was lost in server crash.

title.children: Pheobe Bishop murder accused's case delayed due to server crash

image.altText: a skip bin with salmon carcasses

props.synopsis: The state's environment watchdog has released a debrief of lessons and reflections from a mass salmon mortality event in which dead fish washed up on Tasmanian beaches.

title.children: Environment regulator releases report on mass salmon deaths

image.altText: A man in a pink suit stands before a sign reading 'IT ENDS WITH US'

props.synopsis: The actor's lawsuit against his co-star Blake Lively ends after he missed a court deadline on October 17 to file an amended complaint.

title.children: Justin Baldoni loses lawsuit against Blake Lively after missing deadline

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired woman in sportswear waves as she stands holding a large trophy.

props.synopsis: Australia's last women's singles grand slam champ is encouraged by the new crop of kids coming through, but has urged fans to remain patient with their progress.

title.children: Barty's plea to Aussie fans over progress of young women's stars

image.altText: woman waves on zoom call while breastfeeding her baby

props.synopsis: There are many ways to combine breastfeeding and paid work, for example expressing milk, breastfeeding during breaks, or working from home. Knowing your rights can help you feel more confident when negotiating what that looks like.

title.children: Your rights when it comes to breastfeeding and expressing at work

image.altText: A graphic displaying a number of jockeys.

props.synopsis: The chances of this year's contenders are reshaped as more than 23 millimetres of rain falls at Flemington on Monday. Explore our interactive form guide to all the horses set to line up in Tuesday's great race.

title.children: Melbourne Cup 2025: Field, barrier draw, form guide and betting

image.altText: A former rugby league player dressed in a tuxedo, pictured in profile.

props.synopsis: Former Broncos captain Gorden Tallis joins interstate rivals as a part-owner alongside former Knights playmaker Matthew Johns.

title.children: Tallis, Johns join Titans ownership group in 'full-circle moment'

image.altText: A train stops next to a platform while man in a hazmat suit walks alongside it

props.synopsis: British police are not treating a mass stabbing attack on a London-bound train as an act of terror. It left at least 11 people in hospital, some in critical condition.

title.children: Police say British man only suspect in train attack, praise 'heroic' staff

image.altText: a large hailstone being measured

props.synopsis: Hailstones of up to 8 and 9 centimetres hit parts of Queensland over the weekend. What caused them to be so large?

title.children: Giant hail hit Queensland causing injuries and damage – why?

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor in a black suit and tie wearing military medals, standing alongside a UK policeman and royal guard

props.synopsis: Andrew Mountbatten Windsor will be stripped of his last remaining military position as part of King Charles's decision to remove him from public life, according to the UK defence minister.

title.children: Former Prince Andrew to be stripped of UK military rank

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The father of murdered childcare worker Molly Ticehurst breaks down while expressing his frustration at the delays in the case against her alleged killer.

title.children: Court delays bring 'sadness and heartache' to Molly Ticehurst's family

image.altText: PROXY 1 River Region Early Education

props.synopsis: Daycare droughts are all too common in regional Australia, but in one New South Wales town, the shortage is so acute, the community is cracking.

title.children: 'Families in tears' as daycare drought keeps workers out of jobs

image.altText: Man wearing glasses and a suit folding his hands.

props.synopsis: To borrow the words of former prime minister Tony Abbott, the net zero emissions by 2050 policy for the Coalition is now dead, buried and cremated.

title.children: A Labor 'stuff-up' could be the Coalition's only hope

image.altText: A woman pointing a hose with water coming out of it in to the air as she looks up.

props.synopsis: Communities on prepaid power meters face regular disconnections amid 40 degree-plus heat, meaning no aircon, food rotting in the fridge and long, hot walks to get reconnected.

title.children: Constant power denied to 65,000 customers forced to pay upfront or disconnect

image.altText: cloud over mountain

props.synopsis: About 50,000 people climb Bluff Knoll in WA's Stirling Range each year, and emergency services say they are being called to more rescues as hikers underestimate the challenging track.

title.children: More hikers getting stuck on popular trail as social media draws tourists

image.altText: A black-and-white map showing the village of Kholm in Afghanistan's north.

props.synopsis: It is unclear how many people have died following an earthquake in northern Afghanistan, two months after a tremor killed more than 2,200 people.

title.children: Magnitude-6.3 earthquake hits Afghanistan

image.altText: In a warehouse space, red lights, shaped like inverted crosses, hang from the ceiling, above candlelit tables, where people eat.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's provocative midwinter festival Dark Mofo will return in 2026, as this year's festival reports fewer interstate visitors as "budgets are tightening" across the country.

title.children: Interstate visitors down but local attendance up at this year's Dark Mofo
